p: The global burden of dengue has been estimated at 390 million infections per year, although many cases are not reported or are misclassified. Severe dengue, known as dengue hemorrhagic fever or dengue shock syndrome, is a leading cause of hospitalization and death in Asia and Latin America. There is no specific treatment for dengue, although early detection and appropriate care by experienced healthcare providers can lower fatality rates below 1% [ 34].
